body: 54 (return) [ The two rivers unite at Apamea, or Corna, (one hundred miles from the Persian Gulf,) into the broad stream of the Pasitigris, or Shutul-Arab. The Euphrates formerly reached the sea by a separate channel, which was obstructed and diverted by the citizens of Orchoe, about twenty miles to the south-east of modern Basra. (DÕAnville, in the MŽmoires de lÕAcad. des Inscriptions, tom.xxx. p. 171-191.)]
